reviews.text: We stopped several times on our way to and from Texas. We have found it nice and clean just the way you would expect, and the nonsmooking rooms are really what they say. We plan the next trip this month so we plan to reserve a room soon.

Arrived after midnight to Hope, a small town with very few options. The Holiday Inn Express looked nice but way overpriced, the Super 8 looked questionable, and so we decided on the Best Western for a rate of $59. The lobby was very nice.

reviews.text: The room itself was very nice - that is what pleasantly surprised us. You can tell it's been recently renovated with updated decor and a large flat screen TV. Everything was quite clean. The only minus to the room was the beds - not the best. Also, the A/C didn't work quite as well as we would have liked - it was hard to keep it on, it would just cut off. Rather disappointing, for all else in the room was very nice and certainly better than a typical Best Western.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Best Western during a cross-country trip with our dog. (Best Westerns are pet-friendly.) I have found Best Westerns to be a consistent brand -- usually delivering adequate rooms for a mid-range price. This particular hotel pleasantly surprised me! Upgraded rooms to include new bedding and pillows, flat-screen TV, and in-house amenities like a tall dorm fridge, microwave, etc. It was very clean, with one small exception (we did have 2 flies in the room which were a bit annoying). There was a dog run area close to the room (and even marked on the hotel property map). The room was quiet, even though we had neighbors on both sides. And the complimentary breakfast buffet was particularly good -- your normal fare of waffles, eggs, biscuits, etc. But because the buffet area was staffed, the items were fresher and always replenished. When we stayed, there was a tour bus of people in their 60s and 70s going to Opryland or somewhere, and they looked perfectly comfortable. That should tell you something about the cleanliness and decor of the facility -- pretty standard. But, what else do you need?
reviews.title: Surprising bargain - clean, safe, quiet, and filling!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those of you who mind, the owners are apparently Christian and there is a faith-oriented pre-printed note left for you in the room, on your bed. No big deal - just set it aside if it's not your cup of tea. No one proselytized to us or anything -- just a little pre-printed welcome note.
reviews.title: FILTHY

reviews.text: On first appearance it looked nice, the rm itself was clean as was the bed and bath. The problem came when I had an accident on the carpet and scrubbed it. I was shocked at the filth of the carpet so I sprayed a little on a couple other places and wiped over it lightly and the cloth was pure black. I can not believe you would have such a nice place and not clean the carpets at least once a year. I would not recommend staying there.
reviews.title: What more could you ask for?
A nice surprise
reviews.text: I have stayed at this Hotel several times for business and have never been let down. The rooms are always spotless. The bed is very comfortable with plenty of pillows and nice bed linens. There is a nice desk with a comfortable office chair as well as a nice big recliner, which is a nice place to relax at the end of the day while you watch the awesome new 32" LCD Television. The bathrooms have new tile floors and the shower has plenty of water pressure.

The front desk staff is extremely professional and helpful. Check-in and check-out is very easy and fast. The free hot breakfast is a great way to start your day off, and there is also a nice pool to swim in during the hot Summer. The Hope area has several nice Restaurants to eat at, as well as a new Wal-Mart SuperCenter across the road from the hotel. I have stayed at several hotels and in my opinion you will not find a better place to stay for the money.
